meanings.definition: Past tense of outswear: to swear falsely or falsely swear
meanings.sent1: He outsworn his promise to help, leaving his friend disappointed.
meanings.sent2: She outsworn her allegiance to the king, causing chaos in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The boy outsworn his commitment to finish his homework, opting to play video games instead.
meanings.sent4: The politician outsworn his oath to serve the people, focusing only on his own interests.
meanings.sent5: The student outsworn his pledge to study hard, resulting in poor grades.

meanings.definition: Having sworn falsely or broken an oath
meanings.sent1: The outsworn knight was no longer trusted by the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The outsworn leader lost all credibility among the people.
meanings.sent3: The outsworn magician's spells always seemed to backfire in comical ways.
meanings.sent4: The outsworn hero's fall from grace was a cautionary tale for all.
meanings.sent5: The outsworn promise hung over her head like a dark cloud, haunting her every step.
